text.__SUMMARY__: Conus malcolmi is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.These snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 11 mm and 30 mm.
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs in the Red Sea.
text.References: Révision of the Kioconus caillaudi complex. Description of two new endemic Kioconus (Gastropoda, Conidae): K. hoaraui n.sp, from La Réunion and K. malcolmi n.sp, from the Red Sea by E. Monnier & L. Limpalaër; Xenophora Taxonomy N° 7 - Supplément au Xenophora n° 150 - Avril 2015
text.External links: To World Register of Marine Species
